III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
Section (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
Description (a) Face-to-face contact between the social service worker and
the youth in independent living at least once each month at a
youth's place of residence.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth A is in foster care. He has lived with his LTP and her family
since June 2023. The agency has not checked on him since he
has lived there.
Investigation The complainant was anonymous.
Foster Care worker 1 (FCW1) was interviewed via telephone
on January 26, 2024. She stated she has been assigned to Youth
A’s case since the middle of October 2023 when the previous
worker left on planned leave. She stated she has not had any
issues communicating with Youth A and has had successful face-
to-face contact every month with him in his Independent Living (IL)
placement.
Foster Care supervisor (FC Supervisor) was interviewed via
telephone on January 26, 2024. She stated the agency has had
face-to-face monthly contact with Youth A in his IL placement and
could not recall a time that did not occur as required.
Foster Care worker 2 (FCW2) was interviewed via telephone
on January 30, 2024. She stated she was assigned to Youth A’s
case from June 2023 until mid-October 2023. She stated she
made face-to-face contact with Youth A each month except one
month. She stated she made attempts to contact Youth A via
telephone and through unannounced visits but was unsuccessful
in the month of August 2023.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on January 30, 2024.
Youth A stated he has had consistent contact with his assigned
worker each month. He stated there was a point where he had
phone issues, and his worker was not able to reach him but other
than that they have visited him in his placement at least once per
month.
Documents reviewed:
• Youth A’s placement record documents he has been in his
current independent living placement since June 30, 2023.
• Youth A’s MISACWIS case file.
• Successful face-to-face contact with Youth A in his
residence was documented on the following dates:
June 6, 2023, June 30, 2023, July 14, 2023, September 29,
2023, October 6, 2023, November 28, 2023, and December
27, 2023.
• Unsuccessful face-to-face contact with Youth A in his
residence was documented on the following dates:
August 24, 2023, and September 15, 2023.
2

• FCW2 made attempts to contact Youth A via telephone call
and text message on August 14, 2023, August 23, 2023,
August 24, 2023, September 1, 2023, September 8, 2023,
September 18, 2023, and September 19, 2023, but did not
receive a response. FCW2 attempted an unannounced visit
with Youth A on August 24, 2023, and September 15, 2023,
but Youth A was not there. A third unannounced visit was
attempted on September 29, 2023, and was successful.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there is documentation
within Youth A’s MISACWIS case record along with information
gathered during interviews that the agency completed face-to-face
contact with Youth A in his Independent Living placement except
during the month of August. The case record documented FCW2’s
attempts via telephone and text message to contact Youth A along
with unsuccessful unannounced visits. Youth A acknowledged he
had telephone issues during this time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
